result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin L Murphy Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(7).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

Completion of DOC domestic violence treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file.   Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin L Murphy Jr

records.addlTxt: Payment info returned- Unclaimed/unable to forward
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/20/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

09:27 AM Defendant in court with Attorney David Kennedy Anderson and Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  John D Rice appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to counts 1, 2, 4, and 5  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Counts #3, 6 and 7.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNTS #1, 2, 4 and 5 
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  4 years, each count cc and cc to 22CF587, 22CF898, 22CF899 and 21CF2238

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 6 months in the Dane County Jail. 3 months shall be stayed
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-No contact with: Morgan B.
-No threats/acts of violence against: Tiaunta M., or Melissa W.
-Not use/possess alcohol
-DOC DV treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1, 2, 4 and 5 
-DA surcharge
- DNA surcharge waived. All CC DA surcharge, and V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved.

-Days credit for time already served:  41 days credit
-Days credit if revoked: 41 days credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./mintues emailed to DOC

7/20/22 AMENDED MINUTES
Defn to serve 6 mo jail on Ct #1 in 21CF2238 only. 3 mo shall be stayed for agent's use. Abby H.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief with Attorney's Certification
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
ADA Colleen Lennon and ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State. Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides appeared in person on behalf of Defn. Plea/Sent to be scheduled.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

IN CUSTODY

11:04 AM Defendant Benjamin L Murphy in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. Prosecuting Atty Frank J. Remington appeared for State of Wisconsin. Transactual relation found at no objection by defense.  State calls Law Enforcement, duly sworn. Direct by ADA Remington. Witness id'd DE.  Cross examination by Atty Benavides.  State moves for bindover, reserves for rebuttal. Defense objects,waives argument.  CT finds PC to bind over.
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $50,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Melissa W. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 500 block of Acker Pkwy in Deforest. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

01:59 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
